title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Death Stranding is quite literally a one of a kind game and is one of the best games I have played in recent memory.If you told me I would have a lot of fun delivering cargo to random strangers, I would tell you to pi55 off.

To give background on what this game is about,you play as Sam "porter" Bridges.He is a delivery porter that works for a reestablished government known as Bridges in a broken america,set years after an apocalyptic event took place which almost killed off all of humanity and now deadly entities roam the earth.These entities are called BTs.The whole objective of the game is to reconnect the last remnants of humanity and get it back on its feet while travelling all over the country and completing orders.That's all I can say for the story without spoiling it.

The game play is excellent and it didn't take long for me to get the hang of.At the beginning of the game,you will be doing a lot of walking and running to your destinations while having to figure out ways to cross difficult terrain and avoid or fight enemies.As you progress through the game,you will unlock blueprints and equipment that will allow you to travel around the world better compared to when you start the game.Equipment like ladders will allow you to cross rivers, scale cliffs and climbing anchors can be used to descend from high places.You get to use vehicles like the reverse trike and trucks that can get you to your destination quicker.You can also build structures like bridges,zip lines,roads and much more in the world that can be shared with other players which is where you and other porters will be helping each other out through out the game.You can like all these structures and equipment which gives likes to other players and they in turn can do the same for you as well which is there so you can show your appreciation for how helpful players have been in helping other players.I think this works very well and makes sense with what the game is about.Connecting with people!The game play doesn't focus too much on the fighting side of things so don't go in expecting the game to be a full on shooter because you will be left disappointed.You will get a handful of shooting sections but primarily,the core game play is travelling from A to B.

The visual representation of the game is absolutely stunning.The details on the characters,facial capture,weather effects and the landscapes really blew my mind..Every time I make a delivery,I always stop at some point and look at gorgeous vistas.It's just really peaceful and relaxing walking across scenery that looks close to real life.

The main characters and their stories are highly interesting and engaging where you are always learning something new about those characters as you are progressing the story.Heartman is definitely one of my favourites.Some of them ended up growing on me(Deadman).The actors did a fantastic job in playing their roles especially seeing the facial and motion capture in action making it feel very real and almost like watching a movie which is what Hideo Kojima was aiming for and he succeeded in doing so.

The musical score is excellent.The tracks that would play while travelling across the world added to the atmosphere and really fits the whole theme of the game especially when you're on your own doing your jobs as it felt very relaxing to listen to.As a whole, the music felt very soft and sad which captured the isolation of the player really well while there is no one around but you.I like the music player function while in the private room but I felt it was a huge oversight not to include it while you're out in the world.

As for bugs and crashes,I didn't have many problems on that side of things.I did get a crash from time to time but a recent nvidia driver update seemed to stop that from happening.Only glitches I can recall was being stuck on a climbing anchor on multiple occasions which prevented me from descending down and a BT boss got stuck on a wall while spazzing out which gave me a bit of a chuckle.All in all, glitches were minor.

Even though I've beaten the game,I'll probably still carry on playing it by finishing off standard orders and maxing connections on settlements.The game is so damn addictive that I can't stop and the reason it took me 140 hours to beat the story lol.Anyway,despite the game being a bit of a high price tag,I definitely got my moneys worth and think it's well worth playing.If you're like me and not too interested in combat gameplay,like travelling around the world,delivering cargo,soaking up mouth watering scenery and enjoy a great complicated story full of mind bending plot twists then buy it!I look forward to what Kojima Productions will have in store for the future.

P.S Sorry if my english is crap, I can't write very well

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Buy this if you like:
- a sci-fi based story with narratives tied to real life with many plot twists and some lengthy cutscenes
- an open world with very nice graphics
- helping NPCs via delivering supplies to strengthen your bond with them and get rewards as a result
- certain scenarios involving stealth and subduing living enemies rather than killing them (well you can kill them but bad things happen...) while other scenarios have you use your blood to combat the unliving

It is very much a game where you love it or hate it; it is a very unique game.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
If there is a word that can sum up this game, it would be "Inconsistent". I honestly believe this is a game that you really have to try for once because there would be no other game that is this weird with a high budget behind it. I would also mention that I'm familiar with Kojima works, I've played MGS1, 2 ,3, Peace Walker, and V. With that said...

Death Stranding (DS) is a walking simulator. Not as a meme, but technically the best walking simulator. Most walking in video games have you walk straight to the point, but in DS, you have to avoid cliffs, pebbles, mud, etc. The nature is your enemy and you have to avoid and overcome it. Those little annoyances become trivial as you put effort and invest into the game. This result is a very rewarding end game that satisfies the whole gameplay loop and turns into efficiency runs. That sounds very boring, but sadly this is the game where you have to try it first and see if it clicks with you. It isn't a generic TPS, the movement is its own and people have to know that. It is very delicate, some say clunky but it would be because of the momentum behind YOUR movement. I can vouch that the "on-foot" control is really good, but the "vehicle" control is another whole beast that is just serviceable. Surprisingly the shooting mechanic is really solid, which rarely happens in the game.

DS "story" is very inconsistent. It has good meaningful quotes but also really stupid lines of dialogue. It has the best acting performance but also the most horrifyingly bad acting I have ever come across from ANY story telling medium. With that said however, I ended up loving the story. It is very unique and the fact that they actually mocaped the real actor is even better. I just wish the characters would shut up and talk less. Kujombo writing is like that, I'm not surprised. DS isn't the worst of Kojima, that would be MGS4. However, even with that background, I still think it is too much because of the sudden discrepancy of the quality.

However, the "narrative" of DS is supreme. Game narrative is the story of the gameplay and Kojima is always very good at this. Episode 1 to 3 are filled with excellent narrative that is akin to PT. It is filled with such expertly handled narrative that it peaks at the end. If you know about MGS3 ladder scene, this game has a similar one that is even miles better. So many gameplay elements are used to make the narrative works. It just shows how the game knows what you are feeling. It is just sad that the third quarter of this game was really lacking and felt like ignored. 

If there are things that DS excelled at, is the art department; Graphics, Ideas, Music, and Cinematography. They all are really damn good. Graphics is surprisingly really good and well optimized, it runs pretty well. The ideas like BT, BB, PCC (Online infrastructure), etc are all very unique, The music made the whole cutscenes hundred times better, they are so damn good at emphasizing what is going on. And the Cinematography is so miraculously detailed that you might miss some body language/details in your first playthrough. You can see the enormous effort they put into the game. With these points, I can totally say that it is really worth getting into the game. 

This review ends with "DS is the most Kojima game". I think he went out to be too arrogant with this game. I still screamed out internally what ever the f*ck he meant "Strand-type" of game. If he meant by the walking gameplay, that would be "Simulator-type". But if he meant the Social Aspect of it, yes that is really unique, but also have been done in "Dark Souls-type". However, there is one thing I know. With the news saying Sony dissatisfied with this game sale, there won't be any kind of big budget weird game like this after.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: There's a tranquil, fulfilling kind of fun to be had in this game, even solely within the core gameplay mechanics of cargo delivery over rough terrain. Non-synchronous multiplayer enhances it further with a positive feedback loop of one-up-manship, where everyone is striving to help each other in increasingly better ways. This is the best game I've played so far this year.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Disclaimer: I am a Kojima fan and the Metal Gear Solid (MGS) games are some of my favorite, so I might be a bit biased.

With that said, I absolutely loved Death Stranding. I played the main story on PS4 at launch, and now I have 100%ed it on PC. It has in many ways nothing to do with MGS, while still at the same time having a lot in common. 

Death Stranding shines to players who are not looking for a traditional "mainstream" action/adventure/shooter game. There are boss battles, and third person shooting, even melee combat, but they are secondary to the main game flow which is much slower. It's a game that rewards patience, planning and teamwork - even though you are playing alone, you can interact with other players' structures and other things they leave behind, and vice-versa.

Getting through the harsh introductory sequence and starting to see and use other players structures, slowly improving your character to be more agile and strong, acquiring blueprints to a pretty big assortment of items, vehicles and structures, building a network of roads and other structures. It all leads to improving your ability to transverse the world, and it can be incredibly satisfying to the right audience.

WIth that said, the game is not without its faults. While for the most part it's quite pleasant to play, and the controls usually are pretty good, there can be some frustrating situations with the movement system, and particularly with vehicles, that result in damage to your cargo or even your character's death, especially when you try to rush things. Although you can and will learn to work with it, it can be twitchy and unresponsive at times.

Normally this wouldn't be a huge deal to me, but in a game that (imo successfully) explores the concept of making character movement a core of its gameplay, it can be quite frustrating when it does happen. The second major flaw is the action/shooter parts. If you care at all about this type of gameplay, I strongly suggest you try playing at the hardest difficulty, as only then it becomes at least a bit interesting. But for the most part the combat is fairly "meh", and the majority of boss fights are very straightforward and mostly behave in a very similar fashion - although there are some good ones by the end of the game!

The setting, characters and story are all very interesting, keeping you motivated and engaged with the game and its world. The pacing can be a bit off (I felt that the story was very back loaded, like most of it happened near the end), but ultimately it is worth it as it is quite interesting to slowly peel away the "weirdness" of it and unveil more about it, including some pretty interesting twists!

TL;DR: A true flawed gem that is not for everyone. It does so much so well, but falls short in some places that stop it from fully fullfiling its potential. Gameplay falls short of the brilliancy of MGS V, but on the other hand story and characters are a notch above it, providing an actually pretty solid and cohesive story with little to no loose ends by the end of it. This and the fact that it does an incredibly solid attempt of being unique and original, I believe, more than make up for its flaws and make it at least a "must try" for anyone that's willing to approach it with an open mind.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Yes it is a walking sim
Yes it is repetitive
Yes the story is kind of all over the place
This is one of the best adventure games I have ever played and most fun I have had walking in a long long time.
I don't know what else I can say, you will either love it or hate it. Buy it on sale and at least try.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
TLDR: Good game, grab it at a discount to maximize your fun.

Over all an excellent game. You can tell that the developer put a lot of time into the game. The graphics are phenomenal, as are the sound, voice acting, and motion capture. Controls are a little sloppy, at least on mouse and keyboard. They feel...twitchy. Taking your time and putting in the effort to build up the Chiril Network will top you out at around 80-90 hours of game play, which for a game of this type is pretty good. My only real complaint about the game is that the end story, the last few chapters, just seem to drag on and on. You beat this boss and think "Awesome boss fight complete, show me the final cut scene baby!" and you're treated to another round of go here, kill this, rinse, repeat.

That said, getting this game at discount (which I always encourage) will make playing it through all the sweeter.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Before I say anything, I got 100% achievements in this game 

Wow! What an awesome game. It has some darker elements (like carrying a baby in a glass jar), so I can see this game being, not for everybody

Graphics are awesome in this game! If you have the hardware to run it. Wow! The game looks amazing and super realistic! It very enjoyable just be around and about

Now, the like and cooperation system is new generation! Super cool! You share map with other players and help each other win the game without ever meeting one. You can give likes and your stuff can be liked. This what made me come back to the game time and again, getting likes every time. Even the most mundane tasks are cool! Another thing is, this is a single player game, and I never felt that I was alone. I always felt like I am sharing this world with others, this is what Fallout 76 could look like if they done things right

Building system is novel! You can build and help other on the map, and other help you it too! You can ask for help and resources and share. Building degrade overtime, so if you are not taking care of them, more space is created for the new once, there is a upgrade in the game to slow degradation down to almost a halt, so you don't need to constantly rebuild things. Likes system goes really well with this, and again this is a single player game, and I never felt that I was alone! Just amazing!

Music is amazing! I normally don't care about music this much, but this game has some of the best music I ever heard. I would love to see them play live 

Finally, the story is not everybody's cup of tea, it's bold, it tackles understanding of the death itself! It's one of a kind full of mystery and make you think different. If you can't play the game, I recommend watching all the cutscenes. This story is deep

P.S. as for 100% achievements, this game is not bad. Getting everybody to 5 star rating will take a while with a lot of hard, long cargo deliveries, and getting all 56 chips is going to take time, because some of chips don't spawn unless you do multiple deliveries even after maxing out to 5 stars, and there are some chips that are at odd locations, so treasure hunting time

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
[b]TL;DR:[/b] Not for everyone, more slow-paced than many other AAA games, but if you enjoy a mellow game with a mystery story and a relatively low difficulty, this game might be deeply satisfying for you.

[h1]Spoiler warning[/h1]
I mention things that one gets / can do later in the game. While it is great to discover these things on your own, knowing about them can help quite a bit to enjoy the first few hours more, because you know it does get better and they serve more as a "demo of hardships" than fun gameplay.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
(Note: This is 22 hours in, which according to things like HLTB is about [spoiler]halfway[/spoiler].)

I get that this is a polarizing game, and a lot of the criticisms are legitimate. At least for me personally, things were annoying at the beginning, but get thoroughly enjoyable later.

Let's start with the criciticms: The game starts quite slowly. You deliver things, and in the first area, it takes quite a while to go to places because you have to walk, you can't carry much weight, and you fall over almost hilariously fast. You have trouble getting around BTs. There is lots of backtracking, which is made more annoying because of the before-mentioned points. People talk about things without explaining what they are, and it is annoying because at a certain point things turn from mysterious to confusing (this is really bad in the prologue and continues for a fair amount of time later).

When I started out, about 5 hours in I thought "what is the point of this game, it's just... tedious, and I'm not sure I'll keep playing this if it goes on like that". Things get better one step at a time - you get [spoiler]a bike that can drive significantly faster than you can walk[/spoiler], you get more things to do [spoiler](build structures, hunt BTs, hunt MULEs)[/spoiler] and the "moving from A to B" part turns from tedium to fun because you're faster, get more possibilities and with [spoiler]vehicles[/spoiler], it turns into an actually fun gameplay mechanic: [spoiler]cross-terrain driving with vehicles - I make a game out of getting cargo trucks across terrain that they are definitely not meant to cross, and it's SO much fun[/spoiler].

At this point I'm having a blast with the many different things to do, exploring new terrain and unraveling the story. Difficulty-wise, the game is more of a walking simulator though - you can save anywhere as long as you're not in a fight, which means if you screw up you just reload. Time challenges are hilariously easy (you for example get 45 minutes, the delivery takes 5) but it still felt like "oh I should hurry" and the game holds your hand in terms of what you are supposed to do to the point of it being funny as well (whenever _anything_ new gets introduced, you get one of the characters explaining it to you). This is of course a weird contrast with the "talking about story things without explaining them" part, but it didn't bother me that much so far.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
While the game is a slow burn, I myself find it deeply rewarding and it slowly turned from tedium to fun between about 5 hours in and 8 hours in, and I've been glued to it ever since. For me personally, the hardships I had to go through in the first few hours make the customizable possibilities you later get to remove them just so much more rewarding. In a way, it's similar to the reward you get in souls-like games for practicing a boss or an area for a long time until you finally beat it, at which point it becomes effortless.

One thing that really annoys me though: The game is very progressive in terms of being able to pause and skip all cutscenes, but then in the end just goes out of its way to force you to watch the credits _twice_. First you get the ending interleaved and interrupted with unskippable credits - this would be bad enough on its own, but then the the same credits roll _again_ after the ending, for 15 minutes, unskippable, and in the end there is a short video that is important but plays automatically after the credits - if you walk away to let the credits roll (understandably), you just miss it completely. They really go out of their way to force you to watch credits and punish you if you don't. I paid for this game, stop forcing things on me this way. This leaves a really bad memory of the game and I won't remember anything about the credits either way.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Great game

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
They say this game is a love-it-or-hate-it kind of deal, but I have to disagree - if anything, it's a get-it-or-don't kind of game and I just don't get it. It's basically a glorified walking simulator that tries REALLY hard to impress a melancholy atmosphere of loneliness and isolation upon the player but ends up being a kitschy, nonsensical mess. 

Let me explain: This is a Japanese game full of characters called Deadman or Die Hard Man screaming at you to restore America to its greatness again - quite earnestly too, as irony is not part of this game's narrative at all. And if that wasn't puzzling enough, the story is drip-fed to you through ham-fisted exposition-heavy monologues of said characters or emails drowning in Emoji: The apocalypse seems to have turned 50-something Americans into 13-year-olds. As for the garbled mess that tries to be a story: There are people calling it "moving" or "meaningful" in reviews. Well, you guys should really check out these things they call movies or books. You won't look back, trust me.

DEATH STRANDING, for me, is gaming at its worst: An unrewarding, boring waste of time.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Where do I even begin? I can't even put into words how beautiful this game is. The characters are worth remembering, and the plot puts you on an emotional roller coaster. As the plot unravels more and more becomes clearer to put together. The main delivery part of the game can get a little tedious at times, but you're working towards the story being progressed further. title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Be a over burdened delivery man holding your breath while avoiding black puddles is the mainstay of this overly pretentious and confusing game/story. The game play is repetitive and boring with endless interruptions from cut-scenes, overlays and confusing information. The UI is confusing and needlessly over complicated, as are the controls, even not being able to quit a game when you want to, only when they deem it's ok. It also has an annoying tendency to play action music with no way to turn it off. Its unexpected crashes don't help either. 
Despite its downsides, its idea is different and interesting, its implementation of atmosphere is carried well but it is by no means a gaming masterpiece and neither is the maudlin music.
I have completed this game on console and was left unimpressed, I was hoping for a more immersive experience on the PC and so far haven't seen anything to make it a better game as such. The game is unpredictable and goes from easy to hard without any in-between at certain sections. It does  improve in some respects as you continue but overall they seem to have forgotten that a game actually is supposed to be fun not a chore. Definitely wait until its on special its not worth it at full value.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: yes, yes, yeS, YES, YES... honestly a masterpiece of a game.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
First off, this game is a masterpiece. Maybe it's not for everyone, so here's a few thoughts:
 - The game is really about 50% movie, 40% package delivery, and 10% fighting monsters. I was fine with that mix, others may get bored if they're looking for more action.
 - The story overall is deep, mind-bending, and heart-wrenching. It starts dramatically, the middle has some lulls where it loses focus, but the last third starts to really pick up steam again and keep getting better until the very end. Throughout, it comes together from disjointed, out-of-sequence snippets, but in the end they're (almost) all brought together.
 - Visually, an amazing experience. Vivid green landscapes, barren wastelands, supernatural vortices, where it's easy to get lost in the experience of Kojima's world. And great performances from the cast all around.
 - The main storyline has some variety, but the side quests are just of a handful of basic deliver/fetch/recover types. I was enjoying just going around and delivering packages, just relaxing, and there's an abundance of side quests to go on. 
 - The social aspect is quite unique, and fit well into the setting. I'm not a social gamer, but you can interact with that portion of the game as little or as much as you'd like.
 - I played with an xbox controller, controls were flaky sometimes, sometimes pushing a button again to enter/exit a menu or vehicle. But only slightly annoying.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Game was entertaining enough, it's a pretty slow paced and chill game, environment art is amazing, one of the best looking games out there. 
Now onto the story... It's super cheesy and has a lot of cringe worthy moments, also there's one japanese voice actor (and also photos scanned) choice that it's just plain awful, she's terrible and the acting is super cringe worthy, the character also is awful, but what do you expect, it's Kojima, so expect dumb cringy names for the characters and areas as well. The story, although bad, it's pretty solid, by this I mean it's dumb but at least it has enough story and background on itself, same with characters and every detail in the game. You may like it, I didn't care much since it's dumb, but I appreciate it been solid.
Gameplaywise it's solid too, it's very niche so you may like it or hate it (reviews may show that already), but I liked it enough that kept me going. 
Kojima should hire good directors and people that can help him instead of doing everything himself, he's not a bad game designer, but it's definitely not a great one either, specially when catering to a western audience, he's too "japanese" lol. But at least he's imaginative and brings innovation to the table, which I really appreciate!

7/10

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Ten hours into this, this is definitely what I expected: a slow-paced game that works like boiling a frog. The entire game might baffle you at first but once you get the hang of it, it becomes addicting. There's some kind of slow rush in a title that lets you take its time in completing the objectives. I think Death Stranding is something akin to playing a record through a turntable. It needs your undivided attention if you want to enjoy it. 

If you like fast-paced action, I highly suggest Doom Eternal or Call of Duty Warzone (this isn't a jab at those games because I also like them). But if you want something a painfully slow game that builds up incrementally then gives you a massive payoff in a number of ways (connecting chiral networks, completing deliveries, escaping/defeating BTs, etc.), it's this game.

30 hours: I can't believe I payed money for a game that's all fetch quests. What was I thinking? This game sucks. 
40 hours: Ugh the characters are good... I'll grind it out, I guess.
50 hours: Holy shit, this game is actually really good? 
60 hours: BRILLIANT! BRILLIANT! What a game! 

This was pretty much my experience with the game. I hate how the game interrupts itself with obtuse cargo menus, codec calls/mission details that halt the game (which would've been much better as background radio voice-over?), and strangely, there's no music player. This is a very "Kojima" game, just look at the gameplay before you buy. And stick mostly to the main missions. If you find delivery based gameplay interesting, and you play it till the end, you'll be glad you bought it. Absolutely STELLAR performances by everyone involved. Great graphics, fun gameplay (subject to subjectivity), and just a well thought world that's been created. It's too slow in some aspects, too weird in other aspects, but all around, it's a game I'm happy I played. 8/10 or 9/10.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: One of the most beautiful games I've ever seen. Some really interesting game mechanics, too. At times can be a little slow.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
I've now finished the game and literally spent half a day simply sitting through the seemingly never-ending ending. This game is weird on so many levels. 

It's basically a hiking simulator on steroids. At so many points in the middle of "the next important delivery" I was wondering why I am even playing this game. The very core gameplay (walk from point A to B - and have a delivery on your back that makes the way as unenjoyable as possible, tumbling, losing packages, climbing objects, no stamina, having to rest every 20sec if you climb a hill etc.) is annoying by itself. The fighting isn't fun (because you always have something heavy on your back) and the BT encounters aren't either (they would be cool - if you didn't have something heavy on your back). Basically you'll hate this game for quite a lot of the experience. But then Kojima happens.

It's either the next tiny bit of story gets unveiled, or it's wandering across the most beautiful landscapes that you've ever seen in a videogame, or it's simply the visualization of every little detail in the game (the BT's, the cutscenes, exploring a new piece of the world..) that makes you continue playing. 

If you've played the MGS games, you'll immediately see and feel that this is a Kojima game. In all it's seriousness and dark story line, you'll still find Kojimas charme, humor and love to detail in every single second of the game. For example: I've basically only played the story to find out how the game ends and I have almost 45hrs playing. So this wont be over soon. 

It's a game that you really have to accept for what it is and if you manage to dive in - it becomes a unique experience. I can't compare it to anything else.

Make sure to be annoyed by the weird mechanics and simple gameplay. A lot.

But also - if you let it - this game introduces you to a whole new experience. A new world if you will.

So if you think this is a negative review - it is and it isn't. I hated the gameplay but loved the experience.

Make sure you know what you're getting yourself into, but if you do - you will love Death Stranding!

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
ODD GAME, ODDLY ENJOYABLE...

At this point I am finished with the game. Now I am just killing time and seeing what else I can do. There may be spoilers in this review but I highly doubt it.

Normally I would do like a PROS / CONS but meh... I'm just going to point out things I find interesting, odd, or messed up.

- It is a VERY Japanese game. For anime and Japanese video game otakus you'll totally see what i'm talking about.
- You will shower a lot. Like ALOT. Well, unless you don't mind looking grimy.
- There's a lot of tar. Seriously. It's like the La Brea tar pits had a baby with the peat fields of Scotland...
- America after the voidouts* looks surprisingly like Iceland, is only a few hundred KMs from coast to coast (if that) and has something like less than 200K people in it.
* (Voidout - when a person is killed by a BT an explosion occurs.. something, something, antimatter, something)
- Eventually you can wear so much gold colored items that even "Goldmember" would be jealous.
- Sam REALLY dislikes physical contact and intimacy, he literally has aphenphosmphobia. Say that 5 times fast...
- You will see a lot of crying. Not that you'll cry, but that EVERY character with a cut scene WILL eventually cry.
- There are a LOT of cut scenes. If you skip them you will miss the story Hideo Kojima wove together and the story IS the game. Walking around and delivering cargo is just what Sam does. The story explains why he does it, it explains the world and why it is in this current state. There's a lot of dry theoretical suppositions posed by characters in the cut scenes. YAWN!
- The story told by the cut scenes are really long and painful in some instances! Everyone should just be given a digital novel when they purchase the game so that they can make the cut scenes like 85% shorter. Seriously.
- Single player game but you can interact with other players structures, signs and vehicles. Kojima calls it "strands" I believe.
- I don't really understand the "likes" system. Likes are a kind of social media currency that allows you to get better gear with the NPCs and allow you to level up in general. You can give other players likes. For example I can spam maybe 600 likes for another player's structure at a time if I button mash the 5 key well. I totally do not understand how the automatic likes are awarded though.
- Player built structures can be placed well or they can make you scratch your head. When combined with the likes they receive I am then left baffled. I OFTEN see "land" bridges that serve literally no purpose have 300K likes while a well placed zipline can have 0 likes.
- Every player built structure chews up "chiral bandwidth". This limits the amount of structures that can be placed on a map. If dimwits build a crap structure then too bad. You can delete the eyesore for your instance, but only yours and it has no positive impact on chiral bandwidth. It exists until it doesn't (deleted by the builder or decays).
- Fortunately and unfortunately structures eventually decay. Fortunate because the dimwits who placed a bazillion postboxes everywhere that usually serve no purpose will eventually disappear. Unfortunate because you may be the only one repairing the structures you built. I have repaired the structures of other players that serve me well.
- You can prolong the life of your structures by upgrading them with materials.
- You can get materials by raiding mule (NPC thieves basically) and terrorist camps. Each camp has a specific type of material they hoard. Each area of the map also randomly spawns containers of material. You can cash out materials at each settlement. Recycling found gear also helps.
- Decaying is caused by "timefall" rains. Wildly enough timefall ages everything it touches. The heavier the rain the faster stuff ages. Everything decays and becomes decrepit. Vehicles, containers, and gear just rust.
- Even though a container can rust away the contents will still be good. So don't fret if you look like you are carrying a junkyard on your back...
- Beached Things (BTs) - basically the souls of people trapped between the world of the living and the dead help spawn these timefall rains. The timefall is heaviest around BTs.
- In a BT area if you get detected and you don't "kill" a BT in time you'll see splashes of tar come after you. Best bet is to go back the way you came otherwise you will get caught by a tarry modern art sculpture and have to spam the "V" key while you slowly walk out of their radius... if not you get dragged a hundred meters away or so and have to fight something big or again, try to run away from it. BTs cannot completely kill you (neither can humans), you just go to a kind of purgatory, swim to your body and respawn covered in tar, blood and your gear scattered to the four winds.
- You detect BTs using your BB or "Bridge Baby". Basically an infant that is strapped to your abdomen. A BB is a baby who exists in the physical realm but whose spirit is on the other side (IIRC). They basically stay a baby forever and are treated like a tool vice a baby. Without a BB you cannot see BTs until they you are upon them and you have to do a quick fight or flight scenario. You can hear BTs somewhat, so that helps. BB's get worn out from detecting BTs so they need rest from time to time.
- You cannot truly be killed because you are a "repatriate", someone who has been to the other side and was brought back. Death at the hands of others basically has no meaning. Sam is just a bit different than others though as you'll find out.
- There are a few boss BT fights. They are not too bad once you get the hang of it. Other players who you've made connections with will appear as white figures in the tar, they'll call out to you and throw you gear that you can fight/heal with. It always helps to carry plenty of hematic grenades and blood bags.
- You want likes and help yourself/others? Build roads. They only exist in the central map but are REALLY helpful in spots. I have either solo built or heavily contributed to 31 road sections. I have gotten thousands of solid automatic likes from players and NPCs (I surmise) for the roads. If you want to move around fast but never get kudos for your efforts? Build a zipline network. I built 2 networks totaling 59 zipline stations with a total of 144 likes. Meh... at least I can cruise around the map crazy fast. Sometimes I wonder if people even know how to properly use the ziplines...
- Neat thing about the roads. They float with rubbery tar-like stalactites on the bottom - amazing.

Overall it is not a bad game. I put my money's worth into it. I enjoy my time in it.

title: DEATH STRANDING

title: DEATH STRANDING

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: From the outset the game "looks" boring, being a USPS walking simulator, but the game seriously immerses you into its gameplay, characters, and unique storytelling. the first week I got it I played the game for over 100 hours, taking up nearly all of my free time. And I don't even consider myself to be very into video games anymore, yet this game caught my attention for a very long time and more to come. I definitely recommend this game to anyone and everyone.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Death Stranding is... well... an incredible masterpiece. I went into it completely blind, knowing NOTHING about the story, setting or even gameplay. If you as well want to be surprised by gameplay elements, skip this review. I of course will not spoil the story. 

Anyway, at first the game starts off pretty slow and with some intriguing cutscenes. Honestly it does take a while to get into it and you need to persevere through the first few hours of the game because nothing will make sense. Even though you have no idea what's going on, the cinematography, graphics, and design are spot on. 

I was expecting a "walking simulator" with some topography challenges and 100% stealth. I was not prepared to start acquiring lots of cool gear that let me do crazy things like skate down a mountain on a hoverboard, ride a zip line, or make grenades from my own excrement. Vehicles are a thing (I had no idea) and after all the hours of walking it was a welcome change to plow through snow in a truck or fly over meadows on a bike. 

Things really started getting intense a few chapters in when suddenly I found myself experiencing COMBAT IN DEATH STRANDING! I was definitely thrown for a loop, especially because there are quite a few guns as well as non-lethal options, frag grenades, even armor. 

So, consider that you have long expeditions with hugely varied landscape to overcome, enemy humans, monsters, tons of varying gear you have to plan with, and many weapons as well, suddenly the game becomes huge and full of possibilities. Granted, the combat isn't always perfect and can sometimes be oddly unresponsive or janky. I got frustrated in some battles because Sam would grasp his backpack straps instead of ready his gun, for instance. But these are small annoyances. The game is oddly social as well with buildings you can like and interact with from other players, as well as signs or mushrooms sprouted from peeing. Yes, lol. 

All I can say is give this game a chance. Yes, it is weird. Yes, it is genre bending. Yes it can be tedious sometimes from a gameplay perspective. But it has all the quality of a movie combined with a very solid foundation of a game. It is extremely intense at times and may challenge the way you think about things (I know it did for me). It has many subtle and deep concepts that really make your brain think. As well as some just balls to the walls crazy action moments. The story is captivating and emotional. Towards the last few hours of the game I just didn't want it to end but couldn't stop playing/watching. 

Overall, I would 100% recommend this game. It is not perfect but even the greatest masterpieces have flaws, and in this case it's well worth the experience. I finished Death Stranding yesterday and can't stop thinking about it.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
PROS :-)  Great graphics.  Background music is nice and starts subtly upon entering areas.  Norman Reedus(awesome) did a good job as well as the techies who put his likeness into the game.  Great sci fi story line.  Lots of believable characters (Conan O'brien stars as a re-visitable NPC).  Can run through the main story line or do get 5 stars with every location and receive extra gift rewards like outfit/backpack accessories and color options for sunglasses, trucks, cycles, etc.  Can see other things in the world that people have placed or dropped or parked and walked too far away from such as bridges, ladders, climing anchors, guns, equipment, materials, etc.  

CONS :-(   Cannot actually see other players.  Not easy to find your own friends structures ( theres a way to find your friends body if you both die at the same place, then you can make delivery contracts and see eachothers stuff in the world... i think.   Unless you just get super lucky and start a new game with someone at the same time)   Also,  After a certain amount of gameplay the character enters a very snowy and mountainous area for a time before progressing,  and i myself got real tired of falling and damaging cargo, and moving slowly just to find out its too steep and have to hobble slowly around the mountain the other way.  There are zip lines that make it soooo much easier however you still have to unlock the area by doing a delivery before you can see or create anything.  

Overall     :-)   :-)  4.9 stars from me.  lol

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
So after finally having an opportunity after almost a year after PS4 release date, I finally got my hands on the game.

First i will say that this game won´t be for everyone. I personally love this game, because i like slow and enjoyable games with breath taking environments. Tho if you buy the game you probably will kinda be bored in the first part of the game in the first location, but when you overcome it, it´ll be worth it ( that´s where the game really opens and starts being really great )

The story is amazing to the point i cried at the end ( please don´t watch any gameplay or trailers before you play the game, i watched the trailers again and it kinda ruined some parts for me because i kinda knew what will happen in the cutscenes )

I recommend you read some of the interviews in the game to get the full picture of things to fully understand the story.

This game entertained me with it´s gameplay from start to end beacuse it´s not just holding forward and walking, i was always thinking what path to take, where i won´t fall and so on. So the thinking about how to walk is entertaining for me.


Performance:
- i have a:
 - i5 - 4460 3.2 Ghz 
- GTX 960 4GB
 - 16 GB RAM

And this game is so well optimised that i was able to play at base PS4 settings and i was at 40 - 50 fps, sometimes 60 fps too. Tho in the first hours of the game when i entered the BT area i had huge fps drops which disappeared after a few second. Later in the game this didn´t happen at all.

Problems: 
- I encountered problems in cutscenes, when ever any cutscene would start that wasn´t pre rendered, the cutscene would 
  run under 30 fps, but when i pressed escape and resumed the cutscene the low fps was gone and it was 40 fps again, 
  which is kinda weird

but that´s about all the problems i encountered with performance. So if you´re scared you won´t run the game and you have similiar or higher specs then you´re in the golden.

So, if you like playing games that can be slow at times, sometimes dynamic with action and breath taking with its environment and you like interesting story, then this is a game for you. If you Don´t have patience and don´t enjoy at least slow gameplay, then i guess it won´t be for you.

Pluses:
+ incredible story ( from my point of view )
+ songs that play while you play make the mood incedible and all worth it
+ Incredible performance and optimization
+ Awesome and breath taking environment
+ fun gameplay (not for everyone tho)
- / + Better played with a controller but that is my opinion

Minuses:
- the UI for sorting cargo can be messy but after some time you get the hang of it
- Graphics settings aren´t really that much editable
- First location can be kinda boring / uninteresting
- / + Better played with a controller but that is my opinion

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Kojima's atypical messaging and atmospheric/cinematic vibes shine throughout this game. Mechanics and game play are unusual, but I find them very satisfying. For example, I usually hate delivery quests in games, but Death Stranding (constituting mostly of delivery quests, the very point) makes them fun, incorporating optimization, environment, and a general meaning, that may be lost on some. I could see the reward mechanism, which generally has become standardized from other games, being frustrating. The meaning of the Death Stranding is largely cerebral, and odd, but I see directorship and storytelling at almost every moment of the game and that appeals to me personally. I love interesting games, and I can say that this game is interesting.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Death Stranding. Which feels like Breath of fresh air, the mechanics of game already makes it a genre defining game. Obviously as a game with totally new Gameplay experience and story makes it unique, and its uniqueness comes with a fact that it may not be suited by everyone. Because of that there remain divisive of opinion about this game, some gamer found it to be one of the greatest game and enjoyed while others did not felt it to be that good.
Game is set in post-apocalyptic America where you are Sam porter who is delivery man, so basically our job is to make delivery from one location to other location and to do so by traversing harsh terrains and enemies. The world is visually appealing, the terrain is diversified and sci-fi setting of game made it very explorable and challenging.
As a Porter your job is to transport cargo and it raises many challenges to do that like Weather condition, Terrain it can be mountainous, snowy, river area and many more, other challenges are to manage cargo, tools we carry for our journey, cargo condition, its position, its impact and many other small details needs to keep track in order to make successful delivery. In short every delivery will come with its own set of challenges and to be successful deliverer proper planning and tools will require.Even with all the tools and techniques traversing with the help of no one game will feels tedious and may become unenjoyble.
But as you traverse this world you will realize that there is more to it than that, where comes the support of other players, when you find sometimes that items you needed in certain area like stairs to cross a river , climbing anchors, are left by other players in the worlds and it is being shared by other players. That’s where we realize that games challenges can be overcome with the help of other players and we can also help other players by doing so. for example major buildings like highway require so much materials to build that it will become very tedious task, but since the structure is being shared by other players so with the contribution of materials by other players, highway can be constructed easily. Also with the construction of such structure, the harshness terrain of game become easily traversable.
And that’s the main vision of that game where there is cooperation among players in order to make such a difficult journey easier. At the end you realises that you are not alone in this post-apocalyptic harsh world.
Visually the game environments feels very amazing, also environment transition from place to place and as we encounter BTs feels very natural and good, also as we travel across game many soundtracks are played which suits the ambience of environment perfectly.
Story is so satisfying and mind blowing that after the ending you will keep wonder about it for few days. All the questions that we will have during game is perfectly revealed throughout game. All the Sci-fi concepts implemented in this game are very interesting and logically satisfying. Characters that we encounter in game are also unique and their own personalities.
Enemies that we encounter may feel repetitive and easy after some time, since hideo kojima wanted to make a game that will not have any violence, so enemies encounter may not be the main focus of this game. Also killing is as much as possible not allowed in game ,we can knock out enemies with non-lethal weapons and if we kill enemies there are more chances of BTs appearing in game.BT encounter also feel satisfying at first but they will become repetitive because of lack of varieties.
Death Stranding is a game that if you like it then most probably you will love it.

title: DEATH STRANDING

You see some weird sh!t, but it all makes sense somehow. There is fear, there is joy, there is tension and there is crying - a lot of crying.

It is utterly exhausting and when it is finally over, the impressions and emotion linger.

A refreshing change with game mechanics that are are rarely seen in gaming but are reminiscent of Hideo kojima  ongoing legacy. 
Kojima's input can be seen through futuristic gadgets that make you smile because they are somewhat absurd but hold function within the game and work along the plot.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
A great game. Extremely unique and different. You carry packages over any mountain you can see, you need ladders, rope. vehicles, exo-suit gear and snow survival gear to do so. Eventually you will see other players items or ladders etc, which you can use: it may save you time, your life or take it, depending on your journey and gear or where said "Other Players Shortcut" will lead you.
An Exceedingly fun game. Beyond my expectations, It's just fun walking around I suppose.  looks great graphics wise.
My only gripe is there are no big forests to walk through. Otherwise its nice scenery. Its meant to be an apocalypse but it could use some more trees.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Good luck explaining this game to someone else. It is somewhat weird, but also brilliant. I don't think this game is for everyone, but if you think it might be - it probably is. I reckon this is one of the most stunning games ever made. The complex story, outstanding acting with every little detail of the actors performance caught, the beautiful landscapes and graphics, soundtrack and so on. Truly a masterpiece that i would strongly suggest playing. I also enjoyed the game play - very unique and a lot of fun including the "multiplayer" integration. I had some random crashing issues early on but since the new patch it has not crashed on me once. And i had this game running for like 10 hours a day until i finished it today.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: This is a game that reminds me why I love video games. A single-narrative game with fascinating characters, clearly a Hideo Kojima production, Death Stranding takes the best parts of road trucking games and open world  survival games then turns it into something completely unique. There is a wonderful mix of tense, strategic moments in an otherwise serene game about being a post-apocalyptic postman (in a less preventable apocalypse than the one in progress). Has an extremely easy mode for those looking for the story, but the hard modes won't bring a souls-like challenge. Overall, this has been my best game experience for years.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
It’s really unfortunate the reputation this game has been inherited. I went in with a completely open mind and was blown away. A world I just want to learn more and more about and one of the most emotionally gripping games I have ever played. I really never even thought this game was boring and found myself everyday wanting to jump right back into the world. Truly a revolutionary experience and has hands down the greatest soundtrack to a game ever. A couple weeks later and I am still playing it everyday in the car. 

4.5/5

[h1] Review: [/h1]
[u] Story [/u] [b] NO SPOILER [/b] : Kojima-style story, exciting and full of twists. Masterful character acting level. It's a movie

[u] Game Design [/u] : perfect, many mechanics and fabulous goodies. many missions can be done in different ways.

[u] Level Design [/u] : settings and the world done very well, the secondary missions are nice to do even if unfortunately they are all based on going from point A to point B but personally it never tired me

[u] Audio [/u] : the in-game sounds are perfectly crafted, and the soundtrack is one of the best ever created

[u] Graphics [/u] : beautiful graphics, same graphics engine as Horizon

[u] Game Time [/u] :  long, about 40 hours,  it takes some grinding to complete the achievements

[u] Price [/u] : it's all worth it

9.2

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Dislaimer: I've finished this game on PS4 Pro when it came out. Currently I'm happily replaying it on a superior platform.

This game is a breath of fresh air among many 3rd person shooter type of AAA games. It brings in new gameplay mechanics which aren't useless and actually fun to play with. The main difference from other mainstream games here is controlling you character's center of balance. When you're on foot and have lots of stuff on you you have to control the balance constantly because you don't want to fall and damage the goods or loose them. Whether you like it or not it's a unique gameplay mechanic, it works and it wasn't annoying for me.

In this game you have a lot of tools to choose from and what to use. You can't bring everything with you so you have to manage your equipment accordingly to the path you chose. Sometimes it's better to be on foot with exoskeleton equipped, sometimes it makes sense to drive a truck which can hold lots of cargo in it etc. Gathered (or bought) resources can be spent on building different things anywhere you want, from recharge stations or a cargo storages to roads and private bunkers.

If you reach a place on a map where people live and do couple of quests for them the region around that place will become connected to other player's games. This mechanic allows and encourages sharing whatever you build with other players. The sharing mechanic is made in such a way that it won't spam shared things around you, it does it in a very decent way so the world you're playing in is still playable. So in this game you kind of have to go everywhere first by yourself and then you'll get the other player's stuff.

Also this game has some episodes with just generic shooting arenas in it. They aren't bad but they are nothing special gameplay wise. You can shoot not only lethal weapons but also non-lethal, in fact the game encourages you to be non-lethal. I believe I finished my playthrough without killing anybody and it was fun. You can try stealth and it works but it's nothing special.

The story is surprisingly interesting and makes sense so I was captivated by it until the end. 

TLDR: Unique gameplay mechanics mixed with generic mechanics. Story is interesting until the end.

title: DEATH STRANDING

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Liked: Very immersive, peaceful, relaxing. Almost meditative. Well it IS meditative, but then there are action elements, and the story.
Started to remember every rock and pathway. Started remembeing where to cross the streams and how to climb, run, and just stand properly. It's called learning. Learning the game. The world. The environment.
Leave your home now and go for a walk. Notice who put that tree, rock, path there? That's outside your home. Now go into Death Stranding. Feel it.
Sure you can speed-run, and min-max everything. And then how would you be enjoying it?
No - just walk/climb to the top of a mountain and just stand there and breath it in.
Good voice acting AND character representations of real actors. the character CGI is amazing. They have mannerisms and real-world physics on bodies and faces.
Disliked: hard to describe to other people - what sort of game is it? Hard to say. Very expensive for a walking sim, or a photo taking sim, or a courier A to B sim. But then the game is MORE than the sum of its parts.
Long load times. Look, I get it. The game is massive and there is a lot to pack in on disk that has to load. But once the game is going then the other loads are bearable.
Some video sequences are repetitive, and you can skip them, but then skipping them becomes repetitive. I suggest to appreciate the work that has gone into it.
See that rock. Someone put that there. It wasn't procedural or random. No. I real person looked at it and thought about that rock. and a bajillion other rocks. And put them all there.
How about that river? Yeah. Same.
And why can't I get up that cliff? Think about it. Take your time. Maybe you weren't meant to, but then maybe you can. Find a way. Enjoy FINDING the way.
I recommend it for anyone with a deep pocket and plenty of time to enjoy it. Don't rush this game. Experience it. Relax with it. Feel the angst and plight of the characters. 
And if you are feeling what I am feeling then you will get it. There's a message to the story. Find it.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Man. This game is unreal. Probably on par with MGS2 for me. Story really faked me out and went from about a 6/10 to a hard 9 to 10 for me. Gameplay is fun. Really worth the years long wait. Less you know the better, and don't give up on it.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Death Stranding isn't really a game you play for fun. Its something you play to experience. To simplify: it Death Stranding isn't a game it is an experience. One would argue that it is repetitive, and it kinda is you are constantly doing the same thing over and over again just to a different area. You backtrack constantly and the combat isn't bad, but you definitely won't be playing this for the combat. Despite this being a game I didnt expect to fall in love with I cant keep my mind off of it. It was super easy to pick up for maybe 30-60 minutes at a time do a delivery and then move one to something else, but those 30 minute sessions turned into hours. The atmosphere and the sense of progression kept me coming back. The story was interesting to say the least, but it was the characters that I paid attention to. Overall this game was an amazing thing to experience that I would recommend to anyone, you may not like it but you have to try it to find out.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
It's hard to describe why this game is so likeable when everything I've read about it makes it seem like I shouldn't. First of all, the story is both engrossing yet humorous in parts. Without any spoilers, there were times I laughed out loud at the preposterousness of it all, yet still enjoyed it. The game gets into your head and under your skin and you just want to keep playing.

The idea of being a glorified post-apocalyptic postman seems like it would be boring but it's not. Getting your rating up with each of the preppers to get better gear and even just stars is a ton of fun. Chipping in with other players, who you never see in-game other than the structures they build, builds a weird sense of community within isolation. At times, for example, when your motorcycle is about to run out of power and you see someone has built a charging station there's a feeling of calm and happiness.

The graphics are gorgeous. The keyboard controls are a bit wonky. Hint: you can save the game just by sitting down rather than going through all of the convoluted menus to find "Save."

Overall, I've gotten my money's worth from this game. Played through twice, once on normal and then on difficult.ee

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
It's a brilliant game to play. Not always the most fun to play, though it frequently is, but it is always one of the most satisfying games to play.

A few tips for first-timers:

1.) Don't worry about grinding deliveries for reputation until you get access to a truck.

2.) Don't bother building a road in a region that's off the chiral network. You'll need a lot more resources without other players chipping in.

3.) If a delivery doesn't go well, don't sweat it. Ranks don't really matter all that much and almost every delivery can be repeated. Cargo condition doesn't affect rank as much as you might think unless the order states otherwise. You can always save scum, but losing rank is such a small setback that it's often times not worth the headache unless you're going for Legend of Legends of Legends on every standard order and won't lose much time.

4.) Keep on keeping on.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
After being skeptical about Death Stranding I actually ended up really enjoying this game. The gameplay is really fun but if you are looking for a story, it's a bit of a mess. There are a good amount of super memorable experiences you will have while playing this game. One of the cooler mechanics is the asynchronous online multiplayer which really encouraged me to build a ton of structures around the map for people to use. 

It's a bit weird when trying to recommend Death Stranding to others. This game is the definition of 'It gets better after..." so if you don't mind the initial wait and the couple hour long introduction to the mechanics and story then I would say there is a deep mechanic rich, package delivering, walking simulator that they somehow made really fun and addicting. Definitely give it a shot if it's on sale.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Great game that is really driven by the story and the incredibly rich character development. Game play is hit and miss, and can range from quite a bit of fun to genuinely bland and irritating from time to time. In general though the real draw to this game is the story, which is genuinely unique and deep enough to leave plenty of room for your own interpretations by the final acts. Kojima's oddness is everywhere, but I didn't find it nearly as distracting or convoluted as the Metal Gear series. 

There were a few times where I felt myself losing interest in the game, as the game play does tend to get a little repetitive and stale at times. The key to enjoying the game (for me at least) was to limit the use of vehicles which are not only horribly clunky and very difficult to navigate with, but also tend to really smooth over the subtle moments that really make the game unique. Using all of the tools available to Sam and sometimes choosing to avoid the paths of least resistance really make for a better experience. At least that was my experience.

Overall a really great game, and one I will probably remember for a very long time. In particularly the last 3rd of the game really shines and opens the door to just how much you - the player - have come to care about the characters you are playing. A hallmark of great story telling and something you don't get very often with games.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
what really spoke to me is the genius game design - it is the gamification of the human experience of rising to a challenge and achievement. The game is about marking a destination, planning a route and surveying the challenges ahead - then setting off on a journey, prepared but alert to the fact that you can't prepare for everything. This is life itself - it's school, it's work, it's getting into shape, it's learning to write a symphony - it's anything worth doing.

Thematically the story beautifully builds on these ideas - Why must Sam push himself to exhaustion? Sam learns that he must do his job, because tiresome and hopeless as it may seem, it brings people together - linking people creates hopes, new life - it is divinity. As someone facing challenges of my own, preparing, setting off, stumbling, getting up again, all of this shook me to my core.

I feel that Sam is represents Kojima-san. A man with a legendary reputation - a reputation that comes with the burden of huge expectations from society. And after 30+ years - exhaustion must settle in, and wondering what's the purpose of "keep on keeping on" ? I feel Kojima-san struggled with these questions though the years, and ultimately his answer was... Death Stranding.

title: DEATH STRANDING

Delivering packages in a post-apocalyptic world where you can pee on ghosts and the world runs on likes.  This is a game that defies conventions and really does think outside the box.

title: DEATH STRANDING

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Truly didn't expect this game to be this good, despite all the polarizing reviews calling it a mere "Walking Simulator". However, I needed to take a break from Crusader Kings 3, and this game seems to echo the quarantine situation so many of us found ourselves in, which is why I decided to give it a try.

The first 10 hours or so, prior to Episode 3, is really slow.  I was having fun but couldn't shed the feeling whether there's more.  I'm glad I listened to what everyone said, "Rush to chapter 3 and the game's world will open up".  Oh my, the game really transformed to another level for me after Episode 3.  It was at this point that the game got to the Skyrim-level of epicness for me, and the sense of exploration and loneliness is unmatched.  The story, including both the main and side missions, also started to shine at this point.  So if you bought the game but found it slow/boring, try to stick with it till Episode 3. 

The story was really weird in the beginning, but 24 hours later, having read all the "Interviews" and paying attention to the stories, it actually all makes sense.  

I definitely look forward to Kojima's next project.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
This game is indeed one of the most unique experiences of recent years. As many others said this games is not for everyone. The point of the game is indeed exploration, delivery of cargo and also building. Major part of the later game is the deliveries that will allow you to build structures that will make traveling within the world easier than before. 

If you can find satisfaction in that only then is this game a good choice for you. For me this loop of  exploring/delivering, finding safe paths to take, conquering tough new terrain and then taming it with structures and technology was amazingly enjoyable. You are feeling like a pioneer at first and a builder secondly when you can traverse safely and quickly places that the first time were incredibly difficult and dangerous.  It definitely gives a feeling of accomplishment. And the are some actiony 3rd person shooter parts as well to break the monotony, although depending on how you play they are not very common. 

On the other parts the game visually and technically is stellar. And the Story is typical Kojima. Have to admit kinda more structured and easier to follow than his MGS stories. Great voice acting and very very imaginative lore concepts. Confusing at first but as more information is given everything at least feels consistent and make sense (have not finished the story yet though but until now this is how it seems to me).

If you find this gameplay loop interesting i definitely recommend this game.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: The game itself is gorgeous, and the story line is very interesting (albeit very weird). The only issues I've had is that due to the resolution and some of the most realistic graphics I've ever seen, the cutscenes can be a bit choppy even with a beefy computer (I'm running a 1080ti with a clock). Also wish the controls were a bit more refined because they can be very frustrating at times, especially the vehicles. There's also this annoying glitch that happens when you use an xbox controller to play where if you hit a button once it will perform multiple button presses in game (Like opening the map, only to have it close and reopen 2 more times). I've looked for solutions and apparently it goes away if you use a ps4 controller or download it on the epic store, seems to only happen on steam and will hopefully get patched out at some point.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
After 150 hours and getting all achievements this remarkable journey comes at an end.

I don't want DLC's or a sequel. For me this was a once in a lifetime experience and I enjoyed every second of it. Very hard for me to rate this strange, strange game. It might not be for you. But it moved me and gave me satisfaction in a way no other game accomplished in the 30+ years that I'm gaming. Seeing Port Knot for the first time, making my final delivery story-related and finding a ladder I placed weeks ago, helping me do one of the last deliveries in the game, a few of the many memories I'll cherish. Not everything about the game is perfect, far from it, but it will stay with me in a way few other games will.

Like I said, the game might not be for you. There are people who can explain far better why this game might or might not be a good fit for you. All I hope is that if you do decide to play this game you find the same strange kind of satisfaction I did. Keep on keeping on!

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
[h1]If it looks boring, it probably will be [/h1]
The game takes great risks with both its gameplay and storytelling/worldbuilding which causes it to be a phenomenal masterpiece for some, including myself. It takes you on a grand journey across the US, albeit a very different looking US, to reconnect the people living in this incredibly unique post-apocalyptic world. At first the writing is particularly cryptic, but it slowly reveals itself to be one of the greatest stories to ever feature in a video game. Other players however, will find the slow gameplay and obscure storytelling tedious and boring. If the gameplay to you looks dull and the story too bizarre, I can only advise you not to get the game. Whilst I adored my time playing it, I cannot argue with it being called ‘walking simulator’ because that is mostly what it is. For me that is fantastic as it is unarguably unique, but for others it is understandably boring. 

For me: 10/10. For many others: 1/10

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Original story, interesting and unique mechanics. Can get long and tedious if you go off on all the side-quest deliveries, but believe me there's plenty of content on the main story so is it starts to feel slow just stick to the script. Alternatively if you like being a collector and exploring there's tons of that too. And don't be scared off about the "walking simulator" comments. There's plenty of vehicles and alternatives to help you out along the way. Very fun.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: From what I've determined, this game is not for everyone. It plays a lot like other Kojima games with lengthy cutscenes and little gameplay, if you are getting into this game you are probably here for the over the top story and absurd plot twists anyways. If I were to describe the gameplay, I'd say it's like a fusion of Shadow of the Colossus and Paperboy. You run around over luscious landscapes, soaking in the sights, enjoying the scenery while making deliveries from point A to point B which will take you all over a condensed map of what is supposedly post apocalyptic America, occasionally fighting giant boss monsters and regularly listening to bizarre techno-babble.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
STORY TIME!: I remember looking at this game before buying and didn't want to buy it at all, completely ignored it for months. A good friend of mine kept telling me what a good game this is, I ran out of games to play (that I wanted to play) one day and told me again about Death Stranding. I bought Ghost of Tsushima  and this game, short story I stopped playing Ghost of Tshushima to play Death Stranding and haven't looked backed since.

PROs:
Unique experience, no game quite like it (I mean It's Hideo Kojima0 cmon), satisfying story. There's a lot to say but It's story/gameplay related I don't want to say too much.

CONs:

title: DEATH STRANDING

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Death Stranding is simply the best game I have played in my ~30 years gaming experience. Upon completion of the game I just wanted to play more. Unfortunately, after researching, there is just no game available like Death Stranding. There is no game I could find that is at this level of immersion, cinematic beauty, excitement, detail (in all factors), and pure enjoyment. If you want to be completely immersed into another world of beauty and enjoyment; if you want to escape, then give this game a try. I played the game halfway through on the PS4, then started from the beginning on a high-end gaming PC once Death Stranding was released on PC. The first few times I played Death Stranding on a high-end gaming PC following my PS4 Death Stranding experience, I was at awe at the beauty. The detail is amazing. The lessons learned during my time investment on the PS4, made game play even better the second go on the PC. In this game you are constantly learning, adjusting from your experiences, and trying new things. I highly recommend Death Stranding.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: The world, story and plot are completely unique. For all the movies, shows, games and books I've experienced, I have never seen anything even remotely similar. Also this game introduced me to a Low Roar band, for which I am grateful.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Anyone calling it a walking simulator doesn't know what a walking simulator is. This game has so much gameplay and mechanics that it literally took my hours to explain them all, and after over 100 hours of gameplay it keeps me engaged. I'm currently on my second playthrough, this time on very hard, and I'm enjoying it as much as my first.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Amazing game. It successfully mixes game and movie to an extend I haven't seen anything close to before. The story is deep and complex. After finishing it, there's certainly parts of it I haven't fully understood but overall I really liked it all the way through.

The game part of the game is basically warlking around with a bunch of boxes. While this sound pretty boring at first, the game does an amazing job at this. The world is very beautiful and well done. It is also pretty darn scary place (don't mistake this for a horror game though - "jump scares" are kept to an minimum - you generally have some idea what you're about to walk into once you get a feel for the world). And the pretty good balance mechanics in the game actually make it so walking isn't as straight forward as it sounds. The production value on music is next level and really does an amazing job setting the mood.

It does have quirks here, extremely corny moments there and with a pinch of plot holes (ie. apparently the Death Stranding event also shrunk America to just be around 50-100km across...?), but overall I really enjoyed my time playing it.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Death Stranding........well I just enjoy plodding around some amazing scenery, building roads, fleeing or having fisty cuffs with Mules. I am not your typical gamer, bit old to play fast games, so Death Stranding is right up my street. Graphically beautiful and set at a strolling pace where I can do what I want when I want to. Don't get me wrong, there are many exciting creepy moments, just hold your breath and hope they move away..... so for me, one of the most enjoyable games since Skyrim.
