title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
An excellent PC port of a (so far) intriguing sci-fi adventure that stubbornly refuses to be confined to a specific genre.
Graphically, it looks phenomenal while at the same time running like a dream, even on mid-range hardware (and there's DLSS 2.0 support for those who have lower end RTX cards and wish to play at higher resolutions without sacrificing performance or visuals). It works fine out of the box with keyboard/mouse, which is a nice bonus, considering most Japanese PC ports end up requiring a gamepad.
I'll update this review as I go through the game, but my first impressions after four hours are extremely positive.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
I played this game back during it's initial release on the PS4. I can tell you now this is not just a "walking simulator". This game has a story that is just as well produced and insanely deep as all of Kojima's past work. 

Without going into spoilers, when you begin playing this game, you will be confused. Very confused. I think that's evident from the trailers. However, everything will be explained to you by the end. This game demands your full attention and you need to be prepared to give it that, or else you're going to miss out on major things.

The game is paced beautifully, truly a mastercrafted experience. Just when you get to the very tip of "this is taking too long" something interesting happens to ground you right back down into the story. There was never a moment in this game that I felt like delivering the packages was boring. Carefully maneuvering the BTs, fending off Mules, it all plays perfectly in balance with one another. 

Give this game a chance, don't just play an hour of it and say you already know you hate it. This game wants your time, and attention. And it deserves your time and attention. Trust the game. I promise, if you love a good story, by the end of this game, you will get one of the best stories you've ever been told.


Now, let's get into the day one experience so far. 

----------------------------------------

Only a few minor complaints with the game. 1, we need more audio adjustment options. In some scenes the music completely drowns dialogue, having just one master volume slider is not gonna cut it for a lot of people. 

2, severe stuttering issues in some cutscenes. This will probably be fixed with a patch, however currently at the time of writing this review, it is an issue, so be weary of that. 

3, I have not experienced any crashing myself, however other users have reported that it happens. I will update this if the game does end up crashing on me at some point. 

4, more specific graphics options would be a nice addition. This is less of a complaint and more of a quality of life request. You have very limited graphical options, while the game still runs perfectly for me on it's highest settings, there are some setting I wish had a "very high" or "ultra" option, like character models, etc. That being said though the game still looks incredible. 


and that's about all I have seen so far. I will update this review as my journey continues and things come up.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
It's Hideo Kojima. So, of course it is worth a first day purchase. 

It stars that sweaty guy from Boondock Saints. The director of Crimson Peak. Bionic Woman in her youthful prime. The third guy that played Hannibal Lector.

Like every Kojima tale, your sidekicks all have awkward names. Like your bumbling friend, Die-HardWithAVengeanceMan and DeadManWalking.

There are lots of breathtaking cinematics. Kojima is really hitting high marks on this one, Ridley Scott's cinematographer could have filmed this. Stunning vistas of post apocalyptic Norway, called America in this game, for some reason.

This game takes a page from The Postman movie and shows us how it is to get the mail moving to connect Americans again.

Lots to love here. 

The only downside I can find is that I cannot seem to customize Norman Reedus. I just want to clean him up, that's all. Fix that oily head of hair. Shave those weird random patches of beard. Use an exfoliant and astringent and finally make that face glow instead of looking like somebody rubbed butter on his cheeks. You can put him in the shower or drown him in water, but his hair is impervious to cleaning. And he is just perpetually dirty. 

But, I did do something wicked and delicious in this game. A first time in a game, maybe. I had Norman shower. And once we were good and clean, I took a healthy poop. I would never defile myself like that in real life. But yeah, clean Norman is walking around with mud on his turd cutter.

Seriously though, this game looks amazing and Kojima is a master at suspense. You always feel like you are vulnerable and the bad guys are overpowered and after you. If you like walking around in a horror movie where every step might be your last, this is a great knot of tension.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Vastly unique experience.   In an ocean of repetitive and samey Triple A games Kojima Productions seek to tell something unique and at times profound.  The game play is fun and introspective its decision making combined with resource management all in the context of a third person "delivery" simulator.  Combat is tight and at higher difficulties can be very challenging.  Highly recommended at full price.  Games like this don't come around often

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
I've played and platinumed this game already but i decided to buy it again because of the unlocked framrate, bonus goodies and well, because i'm a die hard Kojima fan and i wish to support him and Koji Prod. I've made an extensive review on the ps4 version a while ago but it's too long to just copy and paste here, so i'll make a shorter review.

First off, before i hear another "walking simulator" or "amazon delivery" joke, yeah you're gonna be doing that for the entire game. It's about traveling West to reconnect people together and America itself on a network. If right away the thought of walking alot, carrying cargo and making sure it's in mint condition doesn't interest you then consider watching gameplay and other reviews to see how you feel towards it, cause it might not be for you just like it wasn't for a lot of people. 

This game really is a hit or miss for most people, either you're into that psychological horror and walking over long stretches of deserted wasteland, snowy mountains and rocky areas or you're not. I personally find myself enjoying it a lot and there's a good balance of tranquility, adrenaline rush and fear. You'll find yourself strolling near a big waterfall and the next minute you're sneaking past BTs trying to not get caught.

In reality i'm not very good at describing the game, not because i didn't enjoyed it, far from that, i adored this game and it's up there in my all time favourites, but because it's hard to put into words what this game made me feel. The entire time i was just in this state of mind that made me feel like it was only my and the game. There wasn't anything in between. I felt so hooked, so into it. I always wanted to build more roads, build more bridges, help the community, i felt like i was helping and that's what made me feel so compelled. I was able to put myself in the main characters boots. It felt like people were relying on me. 

The horror in this game is simply genius. There's no word to describe it, you have to experience it for yourself. The first few encounters will put you in genuine fear and powerless state because you don't know what's happening, you don't know what they are and what they can do.

In all honesty this game just made me feel so many emotions but left me speechless at other times, i just couldn't believe what was unfolding before my eyes. People may find it cliché or boring but to me it was special. It was something only Kojima is able to do with his games. I don't think my review is something you should base yourself on for deciding on buying the game, it's mostly me, a big kojima fanboy, sharing my experience with the game.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Really like this game. The atmosphere is very nice so far, and already a ton of long nice cutscenes with plenty of mystery and weirdness, just like we want it ;) And who would have thought a FedEx simulator could be this entertaining? It's quite a feat imo. I can't wait to delve into it more when I have time to play again! 

And Norman Reedus is perfect for this role. It's basically his lovable introverted Daryl character that he does so well, and it suits the gameplay spot on. 

About graphics, they are generally nice and very well done. The scenery is very befitting of the gameplay, you really feel like you are in this huge desolate wasteland.. However Im not super fond of the blurry TAA effect on everything (but this seems to be the standard in most AAA games nowadays, I guess most players like this blurriness for some reason that I do not understand. A Reshade sharpening filter can fix some of it, but a lack of real native antialiasing outside of just TAA makes some angles really jaggy (like for example railings and fences), especially if you try to use sharpening to get rid of the blur. The performance is also extremely good, in fact I hit 60fps constantly on the highest of settings. Which makes me want to wish I could select higher res textures or effects: my gpu and cpu are not utilized much and already Im on the highest possible settings getting constant stable 60 fps. Could do with even better more crisp graphics. And unfortunately Nvidia DSR seems to be unsupported, trying to select resolution higher than my monitors native 1920x1080 results in an "invalid graphics setting" dialog box and the game revertig back to 1920x1080. Other games do not have problems with DSR, so I guess for now DS just doesnt support it.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
In terms of a console to PC port using a first party Sony engine built for games such as Horizon Zero Dawn, the port runs extremely well despite a lack of settings to be had in terms of optimizing visuals, as well as a 60 FPS lock on all cutscenes, but none of them are a deal breaker for one of the most unique walking sims around from one of the most influential game directors in gaming history.

Of course, if you're looking for a lot of action and MGS level stealth and action, it's not necessarily there. It's a unique, tiresome and sometimes excruciating experience, where the gameplay hook is more focused on the monotonous idea of simply being a post-apocalyptic delivery man, played by The Walking Dead/The Boondock Saints' Norman Reedus. Most of the satisfaction that comes from the game is coming in with the right expectation knowing that you're in for a long haul in terms of story, my first playthrough on PS4 took me roughly 60+ hours to complete my first time through, and that's before getting into the story (which is a mixed bag).

The story is honestly endearing in a Kojima sort of way. Sure, you can expect the out of place Monster energy drinks sitting around to keep your stamina up while you trek across the UCA (United Cities of America) and basically being postman Norman Jesus. While pretentious (I mean in a Kojima pretentious way, you know what I mean MGS fans), the story does have quite a few interesting gameplay moments, and despite what I said about there being little to no combat in the game, it does exist in small portions (I would say about 10-20% of the game) so they aren't a huge portion of the gameplay, and acknowledging the combat sections in general, I would say it's VERY MGS-lite. Fewer weapons (most of them are nonlethal and aren't acquired until 25-30+ hours in the game) and much simpler CQC/Hand-to-hand mechanics that make the combat just... exist in the game. While fitting with the game's universe and story, the combat is a cakewalk, and as stated earlier, does not take up a major portion of the game.

Finally, I have to give kudos once AGAIN to 505 Games and Kojima Productions work on this PC port. At 1440p on my RTX 2070 Super/i5-9600K, I was able to push a consistent 100-166 FPS with nVidia's DLS 2.0 technology, which gives individual rendered pixels a more refined resolution to create an upscaled resolution type look, in my case, checkerboarded 4K and it runs beautifully, despite Denuvo anti-tamper DRM existing within the game as of launch. The licensed music/original score composed by Ludwig Forsell is phenomenal, with perfect music setting each and every scene in the game. The acting in the game is absolutely superb, with Tommie Earl Jenkins and Mads Mikkelsen especially bringing in some of the best mocap performances in modern video games, where yet again, the DECIMA engine truly shines.

To conclude, this game is definitely not for everyone. If you set your expectations right and expect the 80/20 delivery/combat gameplay, along with a fair share of cheesy dialogue, there's a single ambitious vision created by one of the most acclaimed video game directors in video game history. DEATH STRANDING is more of a relaxing but stressful interactive movie with lots of inventory management mechanics. If this review managed to interest you in any specific area, I would say pick this game up once it goes on sale. Hideo Kojima and the rest of the KOJIMA PRODUCTIONS crew deserve at least some love for the ambition shown at hand in terms of pushing graphical fidelity, along with telling an interesting enough story within a dense and extremely lonely, but interesting open world, this is an experience you must try for yourself.

review:
[b]Sony[/b]: So, how much context should we give to the players? 
[b]Kojima[/b]: No.
[b]Interviewer[/b]: Mr. Kojima, but what about the baby in the jar and the monster made from nightmare tar? 
[b]Kojima[/b]: Did you see the ladders?
[b]Game Developer[/b]: Kojima-san, please. We've been coding, writing, and designing this game for months! Could you please just tell us what this game is about? 
[b]Kojima[/b]: You're fired.
[b]Average people[/b]: I never knew my Amazon Delivery guy led such an interesting life.
[b]Kojima[/b]: So, what's this game about?
[b]Interviewer[/b]: Wait, what?
[b]Chad[/b]: I tried to come up with a theory but I can't.
[b]Kojima[/b]: Did you see your name?
[b]Youtuber[/b]: All the characters are crying because even they have no clue what this game is about.
[b]Kojima[/b]: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
[b]Konami[/b]: But you can't really make an expensive and extremely confusing story game.
[b]Kojima[/b]: You said what?
[b]Steam user[/b]: I look forward to playing as Sam, a pregnant UPS employee.
[b]UPS employee[/b]: So, basically, it’s a walking simulator?
[b]Kojima[/b]: Am I a joke to you?
[b]GTFO fans[/b]: We delivered hundreds of Neonates already to the extraction point, this one looks like a walk in the park?
[b]Kojima[/b]: So, you all saw 8-minute trailer and you still have no clue what my game is about?
[b]Everyone[/b]: Alright, we need answers already. What is [i]"Death Stranding"[/i] about?
[b]Kojima[/b]: No.
[b]Everyone[/b]: No what?
[b]Kojima[/b]: Yes.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Okay so you need to know what you're getting into. This is basically a walking simulator, granted it's a really nice and indepth walking simulator, but the main gameplay of the game is traversing the environment and delivering packages. It doesn't sound fun, nor does it really look fun when you're watching it, but it's weirdly addicting and relaxing, and the progression is insanely fun. Having to scale giant mountains, only to later to be able to just zip-line across in 30-60 seconds feels incredibly satisfying. The story is good, but it's also Kojima, so it's fucking weird and a bit convoluted. Overall if you're at least curious, I'd reccomend trying it, to see if the core gameplay is at least something you can get behind. It's certainly not for everyone, but I think it's the perfect game to play while just trying to relax, or throwing something on my second monitor to watch.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
I never had the chance to play Death Stranding until now and it always intrigued me every time I saw pictures, gameplay clips or heard about glimpses into the story, especially since I love story rich science fiction games which this one is.  After playing for my first 2 hours, I am in awe about how incredible this game is.  The crispness, the quality, the audio, the environment, the characters and story are on a whole other level when compared to other games.  It's the fine attention to every detail that really pulls me in to want to know what comes next: where will my delivery adventures take me next, what will I experience along the way and how the story continues along the adventure.

I am getting vibes like I did when I first played Half Life about 20 years ago.

10/10.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
I played this game upon its initial release on PS4. While it is not without its flaws, this is still one of the most unique and special games I think had been released last decade. It tells a fascinating story with interesting twists and turns all throughout, and the gameplay loop of walking and delivering packages has been made oddly satisfying and fun thanks to the balancing mechanics and necessity to plan ahead for your travels. This game is certainly not for everyone, but it was perfect for me.

As for the quality of the PC port, there's a few minor nitpicks but nothing major. For example, the cutscenes are weirdly locked to 60fps, which causes them to stutter more than normal gameplay. Mouse/keyboard support is surprisingly pretty decent for this game, even if the control scheme is a little strange. I find the mouse/keyboard setup easier to play with now that I've gotten used to it than with controller. The PC port also has exclusive Half-Life and Portal content. I haven't managed to get there myself just yet, but if you are a Half-Life or Portal fan you might dig the fanservice.

review:
Only 2 hours in so far
Im using a 2070RTX and the game runs perfectly smooth, although not hitting 144 fps, its barely noticeable less.
You dont have an extremely detailed arrangement of different settings but as far as ports go, its FAR better than most ported games!
The graphics are insane, you rarely see a game this gorgeous and big running this well on PC nowadays.
Of course all the Ads from the original PS4 release are still in the game ( like Monster or AMCs Ride On ). And I am sure those can be modded in the near future. *wink wink* I want a zone of the enders mecha. please modders <3

Same as the console players said, this game is, of course, not for everybody since its mostly walking or talking.

The whole game tries to feel like a movie yet interactive and playable... and it does that really well.
cant wait to play more.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
I loved this game so much, it's definitely more than a lot of people make it out to be, for some reason, it pulls me in more and more each time i play it. There is so much to do within this little world, and at the same time so little. You don't communicate with anyone outside of the characters you talk to, but at the same time, you'll be assisted by those who are playing along side you. The little details are amazing as well, as when i need to get up and walk away, you can literally have sam sleep, and it plays calming music while you are encouraged to step away, not having to fear if anything bad will happen. It's the little things that make that all worth while. There is scary moments, but nothing that'll turn off players who dislike being scared. I hate horror games, but i can tolerate what Death stranding has.

Definitely recommend if you are a introvert, where you're able to be you and explore while trying to change the world.

Keep on, Keeping on.

---

Graphics - amazing even on my potato.
Gameplay - definitely scratches that combat itch if you have it.
Multiplayer- Yes and No, You're alone in the world trying to reconnect to others.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: I got the collectors edition on playstation back when it came out, and the game honestly became one of my favorite games of all time next to bloodborne and dark souls. but i will admit that this game is an acquired taste. its kojima writing at its most unfiltered. the gameplay is slow and can be very time consuming. and it has a considerable run time. id say this is a game where if you can find enjoyment out of doing mindless busy work in something like minecraft for example. where its slow progress but rather relaxing, you'd could probably find lots of enjoyment from this. you cant judge this game by watching it, I tried to do the same and it just doesn't work. to understand what its like you have to play it. and for the few who hated it on ps4 but are interested in this one. its the same game, just a bit smoother and a bit cleaner. we shouldn't be acting like a high frame-rate is the only thing that makes a game good. i know what i said could be seen as negatives, but its gameplay that works well for me. and for me, its a 9.5/10.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Death Stranding is an anomalous game. I know a decent bit about game design, and on paper this game should be terrible, however, I am not exaggerating when I say Death Stranding is my favorite game of all time. You play Sam Porter Bridges, who is tasked with reconnecting a destroyed United States of America after a global extinction event known as the Death Stranding.

THIS GAME IS NOT FOR EVERYONE! For all intents and purposes, Death Stranding is a glorified walking simulator. Think Euro Truck Simulator on foot. The writing in this game is also not particularly good, Kojima is not very good at writing characters and it really shows here, additionally, it's extremely self-indulgent. HOWEVER, the world of this game and the atmosphere is just incredible, and I absolutely love it. At the time of writing I have over 200 hours on the PS4 version of the game and I'm working on getting my Platinum for it. I plan to 100% this game on PC as well. Many of the negative reviews on game sites are correct, the first hour of the game is a massive exposition dump, the middle 30 or so hours are just walking and tiny little bits of story and the final FOUR HOURS is another massive exposition dump.

I want to stress that this is not for everyone, but some will love it intensely, there's very little middle ground.

Bottom line: it's not for everyone, but if you can find joy in repetition and monotony, this game can be a lot of fun.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review:
Death Stranding, a game not for everyone and that is how it should be. I have played the PS4 version and wanted to go for another try on the PC. 
First of all, it of perfectly optimized. My PC isnt running hot for once, the graphic is at it highest and the game so far plays beautifully.
This game has more than a few meanings within it which I wont spoil, a lot of them wont be right out visible, some may say it is just a walking postal simulation, but it is not and I suggest to everyone who wants to give it a try to just do it. Dont listen to the nay-sayers because Death Stranding in itself is an expierence only you can make. 
I love how the game has integrated a multiplayer that doesnt force you to interact with people, but it makes it a thousand times easier to go online and build together, even if you seem to be alone. 
Because this game is about being together, even in isolation.
Keep on keeping on, Sam Porter Bridges.
I'll see you at the beach.

It is a technical achievement in this generation of gaming.

I highly recommend to try this game out for the experience of being [strike] a delivery man [/strike] America's last hope. 👍👍👍

review:
Death Stranding is a truly bizarre game that feels like a triple-A title from a different dimension. While it does have its flaws with repetitive and at times seemingly pointless mechanics, it does bring much to the table in terms of breaking away from the countless recycled shooters that seem to keep re-releasing themselves from year to year.

Death Stranding is a fantastic PC port that anyone interested in should confidently pay the full 60 dollar price tag for.

title: DEATH STRANDING
review: Played this game on PS4. Bought it again for PC. This game is different, many people describe it as a "walking" simulator but this might be a bit misleading. This game is a piece of art from the cut scenes to the new adaptation for PC (support of HDR and Ultra-wide monitors). The story itself is captivating and inviting with the classic Kojima story telling. However, you will have to suspend your mindset and allow yourself to reach the 8 hour mark before the story starts moving quicker. Please give yourself the time to really get the full experience.  9.5/10 the prologue and size might be a bit daunting but the overall story is a must play!
